text: I've just written jeremy corbyn's who
resigned from the front bench and I
agreed to serve on Jeremy's front bench
for a number of reasons I had very well
publicized differences with him on
foreign policy and defense and national
security but I recognized the mandate
that Jeremy had been given by the party
and I also have areas where I
wholeheartedly agree with him so why
have you resign on tax credits climate
change many other issues fighting the
trade union bill I was proud to lead
that work but fundamentally I agree with
everything that Pat McFadden said about
terrorism and national security and
about not being seen to develop a
narrative that this is somehow the West
that's responsible and I have to look at
my own conscience in that situation and
and when an individual like that has
been singled out and for a sacking for
words that I completely agree with I
think it's only the honorable thing for
me to do and to also tender my
resignation mr corbyn's people say that
Pat McFadden was not fired for his
remarks about terrorism he was fired for
as I have it here just loyalty to the
leadership well it's simply not true and
it's really really sad actually that the
the number of Lies and and an
unfortunate statements that are coming
out from the leaders office about the
situation I was with Pat just after he
was informed and it was very clear what
he had been told were the reasons for
his sacking and and he's a team member
he's an extremely principled individual
who has served under numerous labor
governments and he's always been very
clear about his own views but he's loyal
he served the party both in government
and opposition and when an individual
like that my own colleague in a team is
singled out that way for views that I
also hold myself I think it's only
honorable for myself also to lead the
front bench so are you saying that we
should not believe that we're being told
lies by mr corbyn's team well you know
yeah that's up to you what you think
untry i mean III think that things that
are being said that are being briefed
that but I've seen being briefed out
this morning is simply not true and
actually they'll do it about other
individuals undoubtedly they'll do it
about me and unfortunately and one of
the reasons I agreed to serve under
Jeremy was actually his his comments
about the new politics about being open
about being transparent about being
honest about being straight talking and
certainly that seemed to be the case for
the first few weeks and months of his of
his leadership and I was perfectly
content with that even on areas where I
disagreed with him his decision to give
a free vote on Syria was absolutely
right but unfortunately there is a
tendency of some of those around him and
in his team and
be conducting some pretty unpleasant
operations against people who've loyally
served the party in government an
opposition is one of those and there are
others too and in addition to mr.
McFadden I think it's extremely
regrettable some of the stuff that I've
seen and I'm aware of that it's been
going on and I think what it comes down
to Andrea when we talk about issues
about national security about defense
about terrorism you know I've got very
very firm views on these things I know
that many many colleagues share the same
views and we cannot in any way seem to
be be seen to be equivocating over those
and unfortunately when an individual is
singled out for his comments on those
very issues that you know as I said as a
matter of conscience for me and I don't
think given I would have said exactly
the same things that I should continue
on the front bench in that situation
